column5: Thanks for the intel, gents. Those are some nice options.
I'm looking for suggestions on Manitoba, Flin Flon area, but am open to most anything. Ideally, Drive in, camp by the water Use my RV and boat No long gravel stretches Walleye the main target

I fished Kississing Lake about 10 years ago . We stayed at sharons outfitters. Caught tons of walleyes and northerns. Huge water need gps to get around. Long drive from Wisconsin 24 hours we never went back
Kississing lake is 2hour drive north of flint flon. The road is all gravel from flint flon

Jan Lake Lodge is just across the Sas and Manitoba border. Ive been to this camp a few times 10-15 yrs ago and it didn't disappoint. Everything about this place is big. Big water, big camp, big fish!http://janlakelodge.ca/
Mirond and Corneille lakes across the road from Jan.In Manitoba - Cedar, Tramping, Reed Lakes. Reed has a large campground.Bill
If you go to Flint Flon, don't drink the water. I think I've heard there's lead in the pipes.

My wife lived in Flin Flon and had no issues with the water, most pipes are above ground since it all rock. Jan lake is good but there are two places to stay, one has crappy cabins one has nice ones. Both are hard to get. If you go to Flin Flon there is tons of places to go, like bakers narrows . More lakes then you can shake a stick at and all or good.http://www.bakersnarrowslodge.com/

Sorry, Darren. That was just a poor attempt at a joke. It was a huge story in The States last year (or was that two years ago?) when it was discovered that there was lead in the water pipes in Flint, Michigan. It was the first thing I thought of when I saw a reference to "Flint" Flon. I'm sure the water in Flin Flon is wonderful.

Check out moak lodge. I've went the last 5 years and it's great. It's located on cedar (cross bay) so it is a trophy fishery. Can't keep any walleye over 21.5" Our group caught 3 over 30" last june and 15-20 over 27". If you are into numbers and eaters you can trailer the boat about 4 miles back into town (Grand Rapids) and fish the river. Easily catch 100 walleye (15"-19") in a couple hours. Chris is the owner and is very helpful. http://www.moaklodge.ca/Site/Welcome.htmlSent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Thanks for the intel, gents. Those are some nice options
